column3: Total other-than-temporary impairment (OTTI) losses were $136 million, $18 million and $39 million for the years ended December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively. Of total OTTI, losses of $183 million, $49 million and $158 million were recognized in earnings, and reversal of losses of $(47) million, $(31) million and $(119) million were recognized as non-credit-related OTTI in other comprehensive income for the years ended December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
Includes OTTI losses of $376 million, $273 million and $186 million for the years ended December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
